  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40106].
  {panel}

If the number of attachment file's name characters is over 40, any characters are not displayed on Attachment link  of Wiki renderer in description or comment field.
 !attachment_link1.png|thumbnail! 

 !attachment_link2.png|thumbnail! 
 
We'd like to display all file name on Attachment link.
fields.summary: Ability to display all file name on Attachment link of Wiki renderer

fields.description:
+To Reproduce+

# create a page and insert two images
# add a link to another page to the second image
# click on the first image - previewer should open
# cycle right to the second image
# drop a pin comment on the image
# go back to the page view and click on the second image

+Result+
the user is navigated to the page and no longer able to see the pin drop comments.
fields.summary: Pin drop comments hidden when a link is added to image
Sticking header of roadmap planner macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40101].
  {panel}

It seems that there are no methods for moving pages or changing pages order under one parent in confluence REST API (in XML-RPC there is a {{movePage}} method for changing page position).

Would be nice to have methods for changing page positions in REST:
*  setChildPageOrder - for setting multiple pages order at once (similar to {{pageManager.setChildPageOrder(destinationPage, destChildIds)}})
*  movePage - for changing only one page position
fields.summary: Allow changing page order via REST

fields.description: When having attachments which cannot be displayed, they get a "Download" link. When changing the version to an older one, the download link seems not to update and therefore you can only download the latest version of this file.
fields.summary: Older versions of an Attachment cannot be downloaded

fields.description: Can not upgrade confluence 5.0.1 to 5.8.16
fields.summary: Can not upgrade confluence 5.0.1 to 5.8.16

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8.10 Data Center
# Go to Manage Add-Ons
# Note that the default bundled {{Confluence JIRA Metadata Plugin}} is of version 1.7.9 and it is compatible
# There's a "Free update to 1.7.14 which provides compatibility fix with Jira 7. Choose update.
# The plugin is successfully installed and works fine but it shows a warning that the plugin is incompatible

h3. Findings
There are several updates or [links|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40081] in Confluence Data Center that treats Confluence Data Center as a default standalone Confluence version. There should be a way for Confluence to differentiate whether it's a standalone version or Data Center version in order to avoid incompatibility problems.
fields.summary: UPM recommends plugin update in Confluence Data Center despite incompatibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40094].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

I have been using the Content Report Table quite a bit lately and find this tool essential for linking to key documents that are usually scattered all over the system into one place.

I was hoping that you could consider including the following features which would make a big difference to the macro:

-	Option to display the space name
-	Option to display the parent name
-	Option to show the label name
-	Option to display the document version
-	Option to show workflow status if the document has a Comala Workflow cycle applied.
-	Have the ability to arrange the order of the fields

I know that we have the page property and page property report but unfortunately to go through hundreds of different documents including various types of properties can be time consuming especially if we want to point several different reports to that particular document.

Many thanks
fields.summary: Content Report Table
Exporting space to PDF need to have TOC function that can read sub-title inside the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40091].
  {panel}

Originally reported as [MEGA-2622|https://sdog.jira-dev.com/browse/MEGA-2622].

On AAC (Confluence 5.7), the user's avatar in the navbar is displaying a broken image. However, the avatar in their profile is being displayed properly.

The image of the avatar in the navbar is pointing to {{/s/en_GB/5785/ede5f0c65682583b938793f0499809b6742a2089.5/_/download/attachments/907061/joshua%20ali%20%5Batlassian%5D.png}}. The images in the user's profile is pointing to {{/download/attachments/907061/joshua%20ali%20%5Batlassian%5D.png}}.

On CAC (Confluence 5.8), the user's avatar has the same 'static' prefix but is displaying correctly.
fields.summary: Avatar not appearing in answers.atlassian.com navbar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40087].
  {panel}

In Confluence, changing the Formatting and International Settings Date format settings seems to make no difference on the date picker macro.

Before changing, using the "//" command in edit mode lets me pick a date from the calendar.  That date renders as dd MMM yyyy.  Changing the date format in the Formatting and International Settings area as follows:

Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
Date Format yyyy-MM-dd

makes zero difference on the output of that control.  Is there something I'm missing?  Due to the way Confluence doesn't properly sort dates, this is a big deal!
fields.summary: Date picker macro doesn't use specified date format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anonymous users cannot search Confluence through the top right search field. When an anonymous user clicks on the top right search box, the following error is quickly displayed and Confluence redirects user to the login page:
{noformat}
Looks like we lost your session.
We'll hold on tighter next time, promise.
{noformat}

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1 
* Chrome, Firefox, Safari (latest)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable anonymous access
# Go to the main dashboard in Confluence
# Without logging in, click on the top right Search box

h3. Expected Results
Cursor is shown and you can enter search text.

h3. Actual Results
No errors thrown in the *atlassian-confluence.log*. The following warning flashes quickly and user is redirected to the login page:
!loginError.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Go to your search URL directly:
http://<confluence_url>/confluence/dosearchsite.action?
fields.summary: Anonymous users prompted to login when searching Confluence

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence Data Center
# When the license setup page is reached, the "Get an evaluation License" will only provide you the Confluence Server license, not the Data Center license.
# The error message shown is 
{panel}
The license you entered is not valid for Confluence Data Center. You will need to install the standalone edition of Confluence to use this license.
{panel}

h3. Environment
Confluence Data Center 5.8.10

h3. Proposed Solution
Since the Data Center license can only be generated by contacting the Enterprise team, the "Get an evaluation license" link should link to this URL instead. (https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/contact)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40080].
  {panel}

We are using the Confluence Jira Macro to inform our Project Leaders about the status of their issues in the actual sprint. Having done this, we had one idea about more effective working with the resulting table and two ideas of more detailed information.
# 1.  As you can see on image "conjiramac1.png" we would like be able to sort the columns of the displayed report. You could do this either on the ready report OR you could do this in the "Columns to display" by dragging and dropping the columns to the place where they should be (see image "conjiramac2.png"). I think, the easiest way would be to enable drag and drop in the "Columns to display"-Field. If you want to change the order today, you have to delete the choosen fields and have to put them in the order manually.
# 2. We are missing a time stamp for the "Updated"-Field (see image "conjiramac1.png")
# 3. We would like to see the Sprint Start- and End-Date.
fields.summary: Missing functionality when using the "Confluence Jira Macro"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40073].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Background:
I have a large wiki and have sub-pages that often have the same name.
To distinguish them, I've been namespacing them by appending the top-level category they fall under.
Example: "Languages (Programming)"
Problem:
When I then search for the top-level category page, most of the results are for those sub-pages that also have the category-name in their title, and/or have the word "program" show up a bunch in the body.
Example: I search for "Programming" to get the top-level "Programming" page, and instead I get a bunch of the sub-pages as results, like "Languages (Programming)".

h3. Suggested Solution
Proposed solution:
Prioritize pages for which the title of that page is an exact match for the search query.
Prioritize pages for which the words in the query make up the largest % of the words in those pages' titles.

h3. Note:
I understand that CONF-9261 says that it does something along the lines of what I'm recommending. ("Improve search by promoting exact matches")
I'm asking for a refinement of the way it works.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence will not register and save changes in Global Permissions, when the group added does not have the can-use permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test group in confluence
# Go to Confluence Admin > Global Permissions
# Click Edit button
# Add a test group in the field "Grant browse permission to"
# Click the Add button
# Give this group the permission Personal Space and Create Space(s)
# Click Save All

h3. Expected Results
The changes are registered and this group permission has been saved

h3. Actual Results
The changes *are not* registered

h3. Notes
While its comprehensible to not save global permission to groups that are not able to "Login" to Confluence (by having the can-use) permission, this configuration is useful for further nested groups membership
fields.summary: Changes in global permissions are not saved when groups are added without the "can use" permission

	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)

	at com.mysql.jdbc.util.ReadAheadInputStream.fill(ReadAheadInputStream.java:100)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.util.ReadAheadInputStream.readFromUnderlyingStreamIfNecessary(ReadAheadInputStream.java:143)

# Start MySQL database server again
# Try and create a page named "testing unique result"
# Type the string "testing unique result" in the search bar and you will see the following page with no result :
!indexSchedulerBug.jpg|thumbnail!

*Expected result* : The search should work as normal for subsequent creation of new pages after encountering intermittent connection issue. The index scheduler should continue executing as usual once Confluence is able to communicate with the MySQL database server. This expected behavior can be observed in Confluence 5.4 and 5.5 (have not tested other version yet)

*Current result* : the index scheduler completely stop working in Confluence unless it is being restarted and search is not workable for all newly created Space and Pages. This includes the "All Updates" tab not being updated in the Confluence dashboard.

*Note* : This issue affects Oracle and MS SQL server as well. It will potentially affects other database types as well. *You can replicate this issue on a completely new Confluence instance.*

Originally reported as [MEGA-2608|https://sdog.jira-dev.com/browse/MEGA-2608]. The Lasso Plugin running on CAC makes a call to {{UserAccessor.addUser(username, password, email, fullname, groups)}} (implementation [here|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence-bucket/src/main/java/bucket/user/DefaultUserAccessor.java#63]), which essentially does two operations: the creation of the user (via the other {{addUser()}}) and membership addition to the groups (via {{addMembership()}}). The user returned from the creation of the user, however, is returning {{null}}, which is illegal.

fields.description:
Hi,

When running {{atlas-run-standalone -v 5.9.1 --product confluence}}, the startup fails and Confluence is locked.

It's most probably because {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins:confluence-plugin-test-resources:zip:5.9.1}} is not created properly, if I may guess.

If so, it's not an AMPS/SDK issue, it's in the Confluence build. The Confluence build is supposed to start Confluence, define an H2 file-based database, perform a few initialization steps (including setting up the developer license), then stop Confluence and zip the target directory into {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins:confluence-plugin-test-resources:zip:5.9.1}}. This is the artifact which is used by the SDK to kick start Confluence with some existing data.

Context, if you're not familiar with it:
AMPS loads the  by default. It uses the same version as the version of Confluence. It is unzipped by AMPS in the target directory ({{target/\{instanceId\}/home}}, with instanceId=confluence ).

Not only a good zip saves 10 minutes to all ecosystem developers per build, but also it helps us test various versions of Confluence with {{atlas-run-standalone}}. It's important that it works.
Thank you!
fields.summary: Can't start Confluence with atlas-run-standalone

fields.description:
It seems that there is a bug in the jTDS driver within Confluence, related to SSL connections to SQL Server, see here:

http://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/bugs/725/

Similar bug report for JIRA: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-39866

h3. Problem
Confluence attempting to connect to SQL Server over SSL results in Network error IOException: Connection reset.

If upgrading from a version of Confluence using Java 1.7, Confluence will not start up after the upgrade and the following appears in atlassian-confluence.log: 

{code}2015-11-24 16:14:38,738 WARN [com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread-#2] [mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool] run com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$AcquireTask@6478f87d -- Acquisition Attempt Failed!!! Clearing pending acquires. While trying to acquire a needed new resource, we failed to succeed more than the maximum number of allowed acquisition attempts (30). Last acquisition attempt exception:

	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:209)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.TdsTlsInputStream.readFully(TdsTlsInputStream.java:131)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.TdsTlsInputStream.primeBuffer(TdsTlsInputStream.java:100)

	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ConnectionJDBC2.<init>(ConnectionJDBC2.java:338)
	... 10 more

java.sql.SQLException: Connections could not be acquired from the underlying database!
	at com.mchange.v2.sql.SqlUtils.toSQLException(SqlUtils.java:106)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.C3P0PooledConnectionPool.checkoutPooledConnection(C3P0PooledConnectionPool.java:529)

h3. Environment

* Java 1.8
* SSL connection specified in db connection string: ";ssl=true"
* Confluence is using jtds driver

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Confluence 5.8.17 using the embedded JRE (1.8)
# Use the default jtds driver installed with Confluence
# Attempt to connect to a database with a secure connection - adding ;ssl=true to the database connection string. 

h3. Workaround
* Switch the Java version used to 1.7
* Turn off SSL
* Use Microsoft's JDBC drivers.
* Use this patch: http://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/patches/129/ or http://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/bugs/_discuss/thread/16113049/7594/attachment/jtds-1.3.1.jar
fields.summary: Java 1.8 and jTDS Sql Server SSL Connection Issues

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce:
# Create a page with the title containing either double quote (test "test") or colon (test: test)
# Add an anchor with the name test01
# Create a new page and add the link to the anchor (test "test"#test01 or test: test#test01 or test: test	test#test01)
# Save the page.
# Edit the page again and edit the link then save it.

h3. Expected behaviour: 
The anchor link to link back to the page container.

h3. Current behaviour:
The link is showing broken on the page after save the link.

h3. Root cause: 
It seems that Confluence did not translate the page title correctly, as in the page storage format:
# With the double quote:
{code}
<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="test “test”" /><ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[test “test”#test01]]></ac:plain-text-link-body></ac:link>
{code}
# With the colon:
{code}
<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="number one" ri:space-key="test" /><ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[test: test#test01]]></ac:plain-text-link-body></ac:link>
{code}

The issue is not reproduce with single quote, hyphen.
fields.summary: Confluence anchor link redirection is broken with title containing double quote or colon or tab

fields.description:
*Summary:*
When accessing a space without a page name, the redirect to the space home page URL is missing. The space home page is shown correctly, but the URL is missing the page name of the space home page.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Create a space within Confluence 5.9 and access it with the URL http://address/confluence/display/SPACE_KEY

*Expected Results:*
In earlier versions of Confluence the user would be redirected to the URL of the space home page, e.g. http://address/confluence/display/SPACE_KEY/home+page. 

*Actual Results:*
The space home page is shown, but the URL doesn't change. This is a problem, e.g. if you create a link without a page name and some add-ons expect a page name in that case if they're working with the URL.

*Workarounds:*
Directly link to the space home page.
fields.summary: Redirect to space home page is missing in the URL in Confluence 5.9

fields.description:
When a Confluence page is clicked (this includes clicking on the breadcrumbs) on Safari, it will switch from Desktop Version to Mobile Version.

This has been tested with the following iPhone versions:
iPhone 6,2 iOS 9.1
iPhone 8,1 iOS 9.1
fields.summary: Confluence Desktop Version On Safari Does Not Persist

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to the page with a task report macro on it that has user mentions and more than one page.
For example - https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CONFSIM/2015-11-25+Planning+meeting+notes
2. Click to navigate to a different page in the task report or use table sorting
3. Hover on some mention in a table - nothin happens :)
-----
h5.Expected result:
Hovering on a @<name> should work fine

*Reporter*: Vasyl Zubach
*E-mail*: [mailto:vzubach@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Paginated task report doesn't show user popup when hovering over mentions on subsequent pages

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new page.
2. Import a word document.
3. Mark some plaintext and create an inline comment.
4. Save the page.
5. Insert the "Numbered Headers"-macro and paste the commented text inside.
6. Save the page.

Expected Results:
Comments are visible.

Actual Results:
Comments are deleted.

*Workaround "Page History" unfortunately doesn´t work*: If I restore the page to an earlier version (where inline comments were visible), everything returns, except the inline comments. 

Expected Results:
The whole page content is restored to an older version.


_Workaround that worked: Edit -> Resolved Comments -> Mark resolved Inline Comment -> Reopen_
fields.summary: Inline comments can not be restored (macro)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40033].
  {panel}

It would be good to backport the fix for CONF-36503 so that BTF customers don't have to wait until Confluence 6.

NB: This version of the fix _does not_ include the upgrade task to automatically remove any current space watchers that should no longer exist. However, if you remove anyone from a space as of 5.9.2, _all_ space watchers for that space are double checked, and removed if necessary. 
So, if you have any space watchers that you'd like to remove from a particular space, you can re-add one of those users to the space and then remove them again. That will check and remove any watchers for that space that should no longer be watchers.

All space watchers that should no longer exist will be removed as part of the upgrade task that will run in Confluence 6.
fields.summary: Backport fix for space watcher behaviour to 5.9.2
Highlight links on the dashboard tab recently updated like on the favorite tab

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce

A
| B |
C
| D | {quote}
  # Copy content from A till C
  # Place the cursor after D
  # Paste

h2. Expected results
{quote}
| DA 
\[ B ]
 C |
{quote}
(\[ B ] stands for a table)

h2. Actual results
{quote}
| B |
{quote}

h2. Remarks
Note that [TinyMCE|http://community.tinymce.com/tryit/full.php] has no problem with it.
fields.summary: Paste replaces cell content

fields.description:
I am using Confluence 5.6.3 on IE11 and Google Chrome. When trying to reorder pages in Confluence from an imported Word document, some pages can't be reordered. They appear to move successfully, but if I leave the *Reorder pages* page, the pages revert back to the original, alphabetized order. 

When importing a Word document, the pages are alphabetized instead of maintaining the order they followed in the document. I am trying to move my user documentation to Confluence but can't if the pages won't follow a logical order. Thank you.
fields.summary: Unable to Reorder Pages

fields.description:
Hi Atlassians,

We're trying to run Confluence 5.9.1 using atlas-debug but we're getting errors or some strange behaviour. This doesn't happen with the tar.gz one or atlas-run-standalone

Are you aware of this problem?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40024].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the Confluence indexer attempts to index an attachment that for one reason or another cannot be indexed a multitude of bad things can happen (bad Confluence performance, indexing task never finishing, etc). The only way to prevent this is to disable the indexing of attachments by following the instructions at [How to disable indexing of attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+disable+indexing+of+attachments] and then rebuilding the indexes from scratch.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the indexer a little smarter, and if it encounters an attachment that will not index multiple times (3-5?) then quarantine the attachment to prevent the index from trying to read it. This will allow other attachments to be indexed. Additionally it might be helpful for a list of quarantined attachments.
fields.summary: Attachments in Confluence that fail indexing X times should be skipped and quarantined

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new page.
2. Import a word document.
3. Mark some plaintext (no macro or user mention visible) and create an inline comment.
4. Save the page.

Expected Results:
Comment should be saved.

Actual Results:
The following alert shows up and the comment is not saved.

Alert:
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.

Note: Even if I retype the affected word ("West-Balkan") in another part of the page, the result is still the same.
fields.summary: Unable to add Inline comment (plain text)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce - Part 1.*
 # Create a page in confluence
 # Add some text, natural english would be good. Make it of a decent length
 # Save the page
 # Get a new tab and open the same page again.
 # Note: you should now have two tabs with the same page 
 # Pick one tab and edit the page. 
 # Add the letter 'e' to the page somewhere
 # Save the document
 # Go to the other tab, don't refresh and select a random letter 'e' from the text
 # Once selected choose to insert an inline comment
 # type text
 # Click to save
 # Observe strange error message

This will work with words as well. The key is that you need to add a new instance of something so that more than one exists on the page. The root cause seems to be that inline comments don't take into consideration that content might have changed the page in some way. If data it sends to the server doesn't match what the server has then you'll see this message.

*Steps to reproduce - Part 2* 
 # Create a confluence page
 # Insert a Jira issue macro, have it display as a table with a summary etc
 # Add some content underneath the macro that uses some of the same words as are in the issue
 # save the page
 # Select one of the letters, words or phrases in the page that also exists in the Jira issue.
 # Try to insert an inline comment
 # Observe failure message

*Original Description* 

Original steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new page.
 2. Import a word document.
 3. Mark some plaintext (no macro or user mention visible) and create an inline comment. 
 4. Save the page.

Other reported steps:
 1. Insert a link into a page
 2. Add inline comments to an individual word, or word fragment (not multiple words). The highlighted copy should be anywhere on the page above the link

Customers have also reported seeing this issue without having added links or imported documents to their page.

Expected Results:
 Comment should be saved.

Actual Results:
 The following alert shows up and the comment is not saved.

Alert:
 We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.

Note: Even if I retype the affected word ("West-Balkan") in another part of the page, the result is still the same.
fields.summary: Cannot add Inline comment (plain text)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40016].
  {panel}

I use Confluence every day and I am a big fan of wikis.  I do a lot of design and technical thinking when I am using Confluence and the space is too cluttered distracting.  It suffers form the key hole problem and provides information overload. 

Whenever I am editing a page I am surrounded with borders, banners, buttons and other useless crap that gets in the way of what I want to do. I understand you have a "terms of service" that requires that HUGE "Powered by Atlassian" banner at the bottom, and you think it is *cool* (or something ) to have huge top banners, and big empty blue button bars and whatever else your designers want for theme or "image."  But please consider the people using your software and find a way to reduce the noise and provide a clean, minimal interface for people who are stuck using your app.

You are going to get me to evangelize your product more if it suits my needs that you will be blasting "Powered by Atlassian" in my face all the time.  In fact, that banner does more harm than good for me.

Thanks,
-Andrew

h3. Problem Definition
Quartz is unable to recover from commit error (any - either transaction deadlock or WSREP cluster state failure) like this:
{noformat}
2015-11-13 06:33:12,988 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-1] [org.quartz.core.ErrorLogger] schedulerError Unable to notify JobListener(s) of Job to be executed: (Job will NOT be executed!). trigger= DEFAULT.IndexQueu
eFlusher job= DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher
org.quartz.SchedulerException: JobListener 'ScheduledJobListener' threw exception: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed with SQL e
xception: [See nested exception: org.springframework.transaction.TransactionSystemException: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed
with SQL exception: ]
at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.notifyJobListenersToBeExecuted(QuartzScheduler.java:1951)

at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: org.springframework.transaction.TransactionSystemException: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed with SQL exception:
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:514)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.processCommit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:732)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:701)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor55.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:198)

fields.description:
Hi Team

We encounter a very big issue for our product, the Enterprise Theme and I assume other Theme venders will have same issues. Without an solution we have no way to become compatible with Confluence 5.9 and this will break our business and I hope that you will help us as one of your premium partners.

If you use a  plugin theme for Confluence which overwrites the global decorator, an JS error is thrown if you don't have the new elements of the new dashboard on the page. 

Because of this errors all other JS isn't executed and the page is broken.
Switching to the old dashboard style helps, but how can I force this within the plugin, for example if the theme is activate after an upgrade. 
I saw the entry in the database to use the simple dashboard, but this entry is only user based - doesn't help.

*Maybe a configuration point within the theme module could be an easy solution vor you.Just an true/ false for the new dashboard mode, like you have introduced it for the sidebar before.*

This issue brokes the complete dashboard functionality of our Enterprise Theme and I testet with other themes, they have the same issue. 

Could you give us an hint, how we can prevent loading these standard dashboard resources, because if you have a custom dashboard you don't need these breaking resources. 

I hope you can give us any help or you could fix this error in one of the next releases. 

I attached some screens to show you the issue and a pre version of our Enterprise Theme, so that you can test it.

*Steps to reproduce* 
# Install the add-on
# Active the theme
# Create a Theme dashboard with the blueprint Global dashboard
# Select this Theme  dashboard on the dashboard . => The TopStories Slider couldn't be loaded because of JS errors

*Expected Results*
No JavaScript Errors from the new dashboard Resources and the new resources weren't loaded

*Result*
JavaScript Errors from the not needed resources, which break other JS.

Best Greetings from Switzerland
Oli

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.getunik.confluence.skin.core
fields.summary: New Dashboard Resources breaking JS on dashboard for custom theme add-ons

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In recent versions of Confluence, it is not possible to disable only notification for attachment removal because the system sees this action as page edit and send a notification
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a separate module for notifications about attachment removal which consider it like attachment removal but not as page edit.
h3. Workaround
It is possible to disable _page-edited-notification_ but the user will not be notified on any other changes on the page.
fields.summary: Possibility to disable notifications for attachment removal

fields.description:
When upgrading an existing Confluence instance using the Windows or Linux installers, custom ports in the server.xml are not transferred to the upgraded version. 

Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.6.0 and configure a custom port
# Upgrade to 5.6.1 using the installer, and confirm that the port is preserved
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.9.1 or above, confirm that the port is now back to the default of 8090 in the server.xml

Fix
Edit the server.xml and correct the port number. You can find the old port number in the server.xml in the installation directory backup created by the installer.
fields.summary: Confluence Windows Installer and Linux installer - ignores custom port settings on upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39981].
  {panel}


We insert the external image. (ex. https://www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png).
If the image URL which starts "//" is configured as image URL , Confluence's protocol (http) is added to the URL internally although the actual image's protocol is https. 

*How to reproduce*
* We'll insert the external image (https://www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png)
* Our confluence site is http://-----.

# Create a page and click +Insert >> Files and Images.
# Select "Images from the web"
# Insert the image URL "//www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png" without protocol.
# Save the page

We can confirm that Confluence protocol(http) is added internally as shown in the storage format, the image URL is  http - .

 !external.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected behavior*
If the image URL without protocol is inserted, the image source's protocol should be added.
fields.summary: When inserting external image URL which starts "//" , Confluence's protocol is added internally.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After synchronising a user from a Delegated Directory, then disable the user in LDAP and try to log into Confluence with that user again, the login fails as expected but the user does not get disabled in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Delegated Active Directory in Confluence with the _Copy User on Login_ option checked
# Log into Confluence with a user from this directory to create it
# Log out
# Go to your LDAP and disable this user
# Try to log into your Confluence with that user again, it will fail
# Log in with an internal admin
# Check for this user under the User Management section

h3. Expected Results
* User will show as disabled

h3. Actual Results
* User still shows as active, thus counting against the license anyway

h3.Workaround
* Disable the user in the application first.
fields.summary: User Status Not Synchronised When Using Delegated LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39978].
  {panel}

When using the Chrome Web browser, If I open a page with a gliffy diagram on it, the page throws a "ah snap" error screen.  This does not happen with FireFox or IE browsers.  This does not happen if the page has no diagram on it.

This is a very important error to us, as many of our pages have diagrams on them.

Confluence:  5.8.14
Chrome: 46.0.2490.86
Gliffy: 6.7.1
fields.summary: When using Chrome browser, Confluence throws an "Ah Snap" error on any page with a Gliffy diagram.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39976].
  {panel}

  h3. Summary
When a page contains a page include macro in Confluence, even if it is just nested one level deep the page fill fail to render and load indefinitely. CPU usage also goes up to 100%

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001
* MySQL 5.6

Tested on PostgreSQL 9.2 and could not replicate this issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one page with simple text
# Create a second page which includes the previous page

OR

# Download and restore the space export attached to this ticket
# Try to access the 'Include one deep' page

h3. Expected Results
Page loads normally with the included text from the other page

h3. Actual Results
I don't see any exceptions in the logs, but there are multiple blocking HTTP threads (one per page load) and CPU usage is ~100%

h3. Notes
Although this is just an error caused by the page include macro, the CPU usage could cause a outages in production environments.

h3.Workaround
Copy the text from included pages directly and disable the page include macro.
fields.summary: Page include macro fails to render and page load hangs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39975].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attachments of child pages are missing if parent page was moved cross-space. Affects 5.8.16 and 5.8.17.  Upgrade to 5.8.18 if you are experiencing this issue and resolve the currently affected attachments using [these instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+resolve+missing+attachments+in+Confluence].

h3. Please do not confuse with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36497 when attachments are missing in case if move failed.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
* Create empty page (this is the parent page)
* Create empty child page of the parent page
* Attach a file to child page. Click on file and see download prompt.
* Move the parent page to another space
* Navigate to child page, and attempt to download the attachment


h3. Expected Results
Attachments are moved

h3. Actual Results
"Attachment File Not Found"
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-18 at 5.34.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

{code}2015-11-18 11:36:00.092389500 2015-11-18 11:36:00,087 WARN [http-bio-1990-exec-83] [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager] getAttachmentData Could not find data for attachment: Attachment: Version17LaunchDRAFT.pptx v.1 (1769495) username - com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.filesystem.AttachmentDataFileSystemException: No such file for Attachment: Version17LaunchDRAFT.pptx v.1 (1769495) username. Were looking at /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/attachments/ver003/203/69/819203/233/19/1769483/1769495/1
{code}

h3. Server workaround
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+resolve+missing+attachments+in+Confluence

h3. Cloud Workaround
# Download the plugin [here|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/download/attachments/1331462159/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.3-SNAPSHOT.jar?api=v2]
# Place the .jar in {{/data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/}}
# If psd folder doesn't exists {{mkdir /data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd}}
# Change permissions:
{code}
chmod a+rwx /data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar
{code}
# {{nano /data/icebat/local.yaml}}
{code}
confluence::psd:
    confluence.confluence-attachment-recovery:
        target: "/data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar"
{code}
# Run {{/sw/ondemand/install/icebatstrap/install/install-studio.sh -s}} (*no downtime is required*)
# Add *ALL* to logging {{com.atlassian.confluence.support}} and {{com.atlassian.confluence.support.upgradetask}} at https://<hosted URL>/wiki/admin/viewlog4j.action
# Go to Missing Attachment Recovery page - https://<hosted URL>/wiki/admin/plugins/attachmentrecovery/run-attachments-recovery-task.action





h3. Dev Info. 
* Full diff between OD-46 and OD-47 https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/pull-requests?create&targetBranch=refs%2Ftags%2F5.9.1-OD-2015.46.0-0446&sourceBranch=refs%2Ftags%2F5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002&targetRepoId=44
* Dev doco: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CBF/CONF-39975+-+Attachment+is+broken+after+moving+page
fields.summary: Attachments on a page are broken after moving page trees between spaces

fields.description:
The various items in the confluence toolbar/top bar will "play nice" with one another, disappearing if another item is invoked that would overlap. For example:
# Click the notifications box.
# The view will display.
# If you subsequently click the profile menu, gear, or help menu, the notification view will disappear.
* Similarly, if you click between the search box and help icon, the views will disappear when the other one is invoked.

*However*, if you click the notifications icon, and then click the search box, the notification box will NOT close, and will display over top of the search quick results, obscuring them.

h3.Steps to replicate
# Click on the Notifications Icon
# Click on the Search Box

h3.Expected results
The Notifications box will close, showing the search results.
!expected.png|thumbnail!
h3.Current results
The Notifications box will not close and the search results will not be visible.
!current.png|thumbnail!

h3.Additional information
Worth noting that sometimes the spaces menu disrupts the expected behavior, but usually this is OK since the spaces menu is on the other side of the screen and won't collide with anything.

But oddly, clicking the search box first, followed by the spaces menu, then mousing over the profile, help, and gear icons display those without closing the search box--but the spaces view IS closed. So there are some inconsistencies.
fields.summary: Notifications box doesn't disappear when search box focused

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence adds a user to watcher to page although the user has disabled the autowatch. This happens when the user adds an attachment to the page.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as a user who can add attachments
# Go to the user profile and uncheck the autowatch option.
# Go to a page and uncheck from watching the page (If you are watching the page)
# Add any attachment
# Check the watcher and you will be watching the issue

h3. Expected Results
You are not added as the page watcher since autowatch is disabled
h3. Actual Results
You are added as a watcher even when autowatch is disabled.
fields.summary: User automatically added as watcher when autowatch disabled
Manage users who follow a whole blog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Links to Anchors doesn't work if the space is using Documentation Theme 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
* Create a space and set its theme to Documentation Theme 
* Create a page, add an anchor and a link to this anchor
* Click on the link, the URL of the page is updated however the page doesn't roll to the point where the anchor was added

h3. Expected Results
The page is redirected to the point where the anchor was added. 

h3. Actual Results
The pages keeps on the same point of the link

h3.Workaround
# Right clicking on a link and opening in a new window will place you in the correct area of the page. 
# A better solution would be to [switch to the default global look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/switch-to-the-default-theme-762877014.html] for confluence, as the [Documentation theme is being discontinued|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away]
# To make use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
fields.summary: Links to Anchors doesn't work if the space is using Documentation Theme
As Confluence Admin I would like to configure default Email Settings for users
